name: replicapoolupdater
title: Google Compute Engine Instance Group Updater API
description: [Deprecated. Please use compute.instanceGroupManagers.update method. replicapoolupdater API will be disabled after December 30th, 2016] Updates groups of Compute Engine instances.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

schemas.name: RollingUpdate
schemas.desc: The following represents a resource describing a single update (rollout) of a group of instances to the given template.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: An optional textual description of the resource; provided by the client when the resource is created.

fields.name: instanceGroupManager
fields.desc: Fully-qualified URL of an instance group manager being updated. Exactly one of instanceGroupManager and instanceGroup must be set.

fields.name: policy
fields.desc: Parameters of the update process.

fields.name: maxNumFailedInstances
fields.desc: The maximum number of instance updates that can fail before the group update is considered a failure. An instance update is considered failed if any of its update actions (e.g. Stop call on Instance resource in Rolling Reboot) failed with permanent failure, or if the instance is in an UNHEALTHY state after it finishes all of the update actions.

fields.name: minInstanceUpdateTimeSec
fields.desc: The minimum amount of time that the updater spends to update each instance. Update time is the time it takes to complete all update actions (e.g. Stop call on Instance resource in Rolling Reboot), reboot, and initialize. If the instance update finishes early, the updater pauses for the remainder of the time before it starts the next instance update.

fields.name: autoPauseAfterInstances
fields.desc: Number of instances to update before the updater pauses the rolling update.

fields.name: instanceStartupTimeoutSec
fields.desc: The maximum amount of time that the updater waits for a HEALTHY state after all of the update steps are complete. If the HEALTHY state is not received before the deadline, the instance update is considered a failure.

fields.name: maxNumConcurrentInstances
fields.desc: The maximum number of instances that can be updated simultaneously. An instance update is considered complete only after the instance is restarted and initialized.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
[Output Only] Status of the update. Possible values are:  
- "ROLLING_FORWARD": The update is going forward. 
- "ROLLING_BACK": The update is being rolled back. 
- "PAUSED": The update is temporarily paused (inactive). 
- "ROLLED_OUT": The update is finished, all instances have been updated successfully. 
- "ROLLED_BACK": The update is finished, all instances have been reverted to the previous template. 
- "CANCELLED": The update is paused and no longer can be resumed, undefined how many instances are running in which template.

fields.name: actionType
fields.desc: Specifies the action to take for each instance within the instance group. This can be RECREATE which will recreate each instance and is only available for managed instance groups. It can also be REBOOT which performs a soft reboot for each instance and is only available for regular (non-managed) instance groups.

fields.name: error
fields.desc: [Output Only] Errors that occurred during the rolling update.

fields.name: errors
fields.desc: [Output Only] The array of errors encountered while processing this operation.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: [Output Only] The error type identifier for this error.

fields.name: location
fields.desc: [Output Only] Indicates the field in the request that caused the error. This property is optional.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable error message.

fields.name: instanceGroup
fields.desc: Fully-qualified URL of an instance group being updated. Exactly one of instanceGroupManager and instanceGroup must be set.

fields.name: instanceTemplate
fields.desc: Fully-qualified URL of an instance template to apply.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output Only] Type of the resource.

fields.name: progress
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional progress indicator that ranges from 0 to 100. There is no requirement that this be linear or support any granularity of operations. This should not be used to guess at when the update will be complete. This number should be monotonically increasing as the update progresses.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] The fully qualified URL for the resource.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.desc: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

fields.name: oldInstanceTemplate
fields.desc: Fully-qualified URL of the instance template encountered while starting the update.

fields.name: statusMessage
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional textual description of the current status of the update.

fields.name: user
fields.desc: [Output Only] User who requested the update, for example: user@example.com.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: A token used to continue a truncated list request.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] The fully qualified URL for the resource.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Collection of requested updates.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output Only] Type of the resource.

fields.name: error
fields.desc: Errors that occurred during the instance update.

fields.name: errors
fields.desc: [Output Only] The array of errors encountered while processing this operation.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: [Output Only] The error type identifier for this error.

fields.name: location
fields.desc: [Output Only] Indicates the field in the request that caused the error. This property is optional.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable error message.

fields.name: instance
fields.desc: Fully-qualified URL of the instance being updated.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
Status of the instance update. Possible values are:  
- "PENDING": The instance update is pending execution. 
- "ROLLING_FORWARD": The instance update is going forward. 
- "ROLLING_BACK": The instance update is being rolled back. 
- "PAUSED": The instance update is temporarily paused (inactive). 
- "ROLLED_OUT": The instance update is finished, the instance is running the new template. 
- "ROLLED_BACK": The instance update is finished, the instance has been reverted to the previous template. 
- "CANCELLED": The instance update is paused and no longer can be resumed, undefined in which template the instance is running.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Collection of requested instance updates.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output Only] Type of the resource.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: A token used to continue a truncated list request.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] The fully qualified URL for the resource.

methods.name: listInstanceUpdates
methods.desc: Lists the current status for each instance within a given update.

methods.name: pause
methods.desc: Pauses the update in state from ROLLING_FORWARD or ROLLING_BACK. Has no effect if invoked when the state of the update is PAUSED.

methods.name: resume
methods.desc: Continues an update in PAUSED state. Has no effect if invoked when the state of the update is ROLLED_OUT.

methods.name: rollback
methods.desc: Rolls back the update in state from ROLLING_FORWARD or PAUSED. Has no effect if invoked when the state of the update is ROLLED_BACK.

methods.name: cancel
